talk.author: did:plc:rznwnsf5q4iuq3st27jcyddp
talk.utter: This isn’t true. I want to be able to trust that particular accounts, especially media, are the verified sources for information, not some disinformation spreader. I don’t give a shit if others aren’t “verified”.

talk.author: did:plc:rznwnsf5q4iuq3st27jcyddp
talk.utter: What makes you think I don’t already do that?

talk.author: did:plc:rznwnsf5q4iuq3st27jcyddp
talk.utter: This isn’t true. I want to be able to trust that particular accounts, especially media, are the verified sources for information, not some disinformation spreader. I don’t give a shit if others aren’t “verified”.

talk.author: did:plc:n3m2vtoemu3mxso6fdcxq62o
talk.utter: you can tell if nytimes.com is their official account because they were able to verify the domain

talk.author: did:plc:rznwnsf5q4iuq3st27jcyddp
talk.utter:
First of all, that’s not the only newspaper. And secondly, it’s incredibly easy to create a spoof domain and fool people into thinking it’s legit. It’s how scammers operate or have you never had phishing training? 

Why are you against actual verification?
